title: Diego Costa Set To Sign Monster New Deal With Chelsea
text:
Diego Costa Set To Sign Monster New Deal With Chelsea Wed Feb 15 2017 00:49:40 GMT+0000 (GMT) Wed Feb 15 2017 00:49:40 GMT+0000 (GMT) Ryan Sidle Ryan Sidle in football 
Just over a month ago Diego Costa was dropped from the Chelsea team for a 'bad back' and then it was reported that he rejected a new contract as he eyed up a move to China now he is set to sign that new contract! 
Before the league leaders meeting with Premier League champions Leicester City the previously undroppable Costa was suddenly out of Antonio Conte's squad. 
There were rumours of a training ground bust up, a rejected contract and Costa pulling a Payet and not playing for the club again in order to push through a huge move to China. 
That seemed to blow over quickly with the Spanish striker only missing one game but it was thought the peace would only last till the summer with Costa moving to the Far East or back to Atletico Madrid. 
However, according to The Sun , Costa is now on the verge of signing a new bumper five year deal with the striker being paid a basic of £220k-a-week. 
With bonuses the 28 year old's wage could go from £57 million, over the five years, to a whopping £65 million, no small change for sure. 
The newspaper claim that the striker, who had a hard paper round as a child, is set to leapfrog Cesc Fabregas as the club's top earner. 
The new wages would also take him into the top five of the Premier League's top earners although he would still be someway short of Wayne Rooney's well earnt £300k-a-week.

Last month the Sun claimed that Costa had been after £300k-a-week to keep him at Stamford Bridge after the offer from Tianjin Quanjian would have earned him a ridiculous £575k-a-week . 
The former Atleti frontman scored 32 goals in his first two seasons in England and has continued his scoring with another 15 so far this term. 
His goals have helped take Chelsea well clear at the top of the table this season. 
Costa looks to be staying in the Premier League, sorry defenders! Sponsored Links
